name: Crime
description: Sometimes it pays to be bad. A character who wants to engage in criminal activity -- whether burglary, robbery, or some other crime -- can do so as a downtime activity.
costPerDay: 25 GP for bribes, equipment, and expenses
resolution: The character makes three checks: Dexterity (Stealth), Dexterity using Thieves' Tools, and the character's choice of Intelligence (Investigation), Wisdom (Perception), or Charisma (Deception). Compare successes to failures.

checks.description: Represents the character's ability to avoid detection during the crime.
Represents the ability to bypass locks, traps, and other security measures.
Represents casing the target, spotting guards, or talking your way out of trouble.

results.result: The character is caught and jailed. The character must pay a fine equal to the potential earnings to avoid jail time, or spend time in jail (DM determines).
The heist is a partial failure. Earnings: 5d10 GP, but a witness or clue may lead to complications later.
The crime goes well. Earnings: 10d10 GP.
A perfect crime. Earnings: 15d10 GP, and no evidence is left behind.
